name: 6-methylpyridine-2-carboxaldehyde
Reason: 6-methylpyridine-2-carboxaldehyde has a basic structure similar to benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C. The methyl group adds approximately 10°C to the melting point, and the carboxyl group may contribute around +5°C due to increased molecular weight and possible hydrogen bonding.
